description: Light, malty ale with nice sweet backbone and crisp finish

style.description: Kölsch is warm fermented and aged at cold temperatures (German ale or alt-style beer). Kölsch is characterized by a golden to straw color and a slightly dry, subtly sweet softness on the palate, yet crisp. Good, dense head retention is desirable. Light pearapple-Riesling wine-like fruitiness may be apparent, but is not necessary for this style. Caramel character should not be evident. The body is light to medium-light. This beer has low hop flavor and aroma with medium bitterness. Wheat can be used in brewing this beer. Ale yeast is used for fermentation, though lager yeast is sometimes used in the bottle or final cold conditioning process. Fruity esters should be minimally perceived, if at all. Chill haze should be absent.
style.name: German-Style Kölsch / Köln-Style Kölsch

description: Hailing from Cologne, Germany this rare style of Ale is served in a 9oz ‘Stange’ glass to highlight is straw color, high carbonation, and easy drink- ability. Notes of bread and a slight bitterness make this an easy drinking Ale.

description: One of our signature brews, this German-style golden ale originates in the Köln (Cologne) region of Germany. Restrained hop bitterness is produced by the use of German noble Hersbrucker hops, which add a subtle fresh piney or spicy note. The authentic Kölsch yeast produces a clean crisp beer with lager aroma notes. German malts provide the backbone.

description:
The classic Gaffel Koelsch is a particularly fresh speciality beer from Cologne, brewed according to a time-honoured family recipe and the German Purity Law of 1516 with water, malt, hops, and hops extract.

The delicately bitter, pleasant, slightly hopsy taste is characteristic of this traditional product and clearly distinguishes Gaffel Koelsch from all other Koelsch brands.

description: Our golden ale is brewed to refresh on the hottest of days. Premium European and honey malts with German hops. If you need an answer to the Texas heat, this crisp German classic is it!

description: Light in color and alcohol, this beer style originates in Cologne, Germany.  Quintessential Kolsch beers have an almost Cheerio aroma with green apple or pear rounding out the aroma.  Flavor is crisp and clean with a hint of fruity sweetness.

description: Kölsch is a German style lager that is crisp and refreshing. The hoppiness is prominent but not extreme and is less bitter than a standard German pale lager.

name: Kölsch

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

description: The Kölsch beer was born in Cologne (Köln), Germany, and rides the line between an ale and a lager. Attempting to make a lager, historic conditions prevented the Kölsch beer from fermenting cool enough to qualify as a true lager. Our version drinks like a German Pils or Pale Lager, but with less bitterness and a slight fruitiness imparted by the unique yeast strain. Bright, straw-yellow, and smooth, Kölsch is a perfect summer lawnmower beer. Available draft only until we’ve had enough, which may be awhile…

description: In Cologne, Germany, many a brewery produces a light-bodied ale with a delicate fruitiness and rounded maltiness, attributable to the unique yeast strain commonly used. Our Kölsch is unfiltered and more generously hopped than its German cousin.

hops.description: Bred in Germany from Northern Brewer, Perle was an attempt at a higher-alpha replacement for Hallertauer Mittelfr?her. It has a pleasant aroma with a minty character. American versions have a very different profile than those grown in Germany.
hops.name: Perle (American)

characteristics.description: Imparts a malty flavor upon the beer.
characteristics.name: Malty

characteristics.description: Imparts a sweet flavor upon the beer.
characteristics.name: Sweet

malt.description: Munich Malt has a malty sweet flavor characteristic and adds a reddish amber color to the beer. It has enough diastatic power to convert itself, but needs help from another malt, such as 2-row malt, to convert other grains.
malt.name: Munich Malt

name: Kölsch

description: Pale yellow in color, and pours with a persistent frothy white head. Carries delicate herbal aromas, with hints of pineapple pear, and green apple, with a crisp yet smooth maltiness. Brewed with Weyermann Pilsner and Pale malt, Northern Brewer and Spalt hops, and our proprietary German ale yeast strain.

description: The Kolsch is a classic German Ale, perfect for the summer.  This beer is mild all around- not a lot of malt, not a lot of hops.   Our current variant, the Kolkata, uses Indian spices such as coriander and cardamom, and pairs nicely with spicy food.

description: Hale’s version of this traditional German light ale won a Gold Medal at the Great American Beer Festival in 2010! It is similar to pilsner in flavor, light, subtle and thirst quenching. Hale's Kolsch is available all year round on draft; it is our designated "Spring/Summer" seasonal beer in 12oz. bottles.

available.name: Year Round

description: Thirst quenching, crisp, with a dry finish, this German Ale (pronounced Cœllsh) is the local brew of the city of Cologne (“Köln” in German). It is one of the palest German beers made and is considered Germany's answer to the British pale ale. Utilizing German malted barley from a malt-house situated outside Köln and dry hopped with outstanding Hallertau Mittelfrueh hops, this light bodied golden beer is oak aged (lagered) for six weeks on French Oak.

description: A delicious example of this German classic. Medium body, light straw in color with a creamy head. Mild hops presence and dry fruity finish make this a perfect beer for tailgating season.

style.name: German-Style Kölsch / Köln-Style Kölsch

name: Kölsch

description: This beer style originates in Köln, Germany and is very well known for being lighter bodied, slightly hazy, crisp and refreshing.  It is fermented with an ale yeast that acts similar to a lager yeast and performs well in lower temperatures.  To further enhance the crisp qualities imparted by this unique yeast, we use wheat as part of the grain bill and the slightly spicy and crisp German Tetnang hops.  All in all an easy drinking, very thirst quenching beer, perfect for a day in the sun or paired with a light flavored fish.

style.description: Kölsch is warm fermented and aged at cold temperatures (German ale or alt-style beer). description: A German style golden ale with some lager characteristics. Refreshing with a slight winy/vinous flavor.

description: A traditional German Ale from the city of Köln, this style provides the best of both worlds. It has the light body and easy drinking characteristics of a lager but backs it up with the malt complexity of an ale. Inspired by our brother Jon and our love for sessionable beer.

description: This bier is delicate and pale with less bitterness than a Pils and less sweetness than a Helles. A subtle fruitiness is the hallmark of this classic style from Köln. Along with Alt, this is one of the last ale holdouts in Germany

name: Kölsch

description: Covington Kolsch is the beer our brewery was founded on. Is very easy drinking wheat ale with a slight citrus flavor and aroma from the German noble hops it is brewed with. It is fermented at higher ale temperatures then cold conditioned like most lagers so you get the best of both worlds. A fruity aroma like an ale with a crisp, clean finish like a lager.

available.name: Seasonal

description: A vivid, zippy beer brewed in the traditional German style. Brilliant clarity, subdued, maltiness, and a pleasant lemony tang all combine to make this brew utterly quaffable.

style.description: Kölsch is warm fermented and aged at cold temperatures (German ale or alt-style beer). Kölsch is characterized by a golden to straw color and a slightly dry, subtly sweet softness on the palate, yet crisp. Good, dense head retention is desirable. Light pearapple-Riesling wine-like fruitiness may be apparent, but is not necessary for this style. Caramel character should not be evident. The body is light to medium-light. This beer has low hop flavor and aroma with medium bitterness. Wheat can be used in brewing this beer. Ale yeast is used for fermentation, though lager yeast is sometimes used in the bottle or final cold conditioning process. Fruity esters should be minimally perceived, if at all. Chill haze should be absent.
style.name: German-Style Kölsch / Köln-Style Kölsch

name: Kolsch

description: The kolsch is light in color and has a bouquet of lemon and wheat. The style is clean and has light, bready malt tones. A laid back bitterness finishes the beer, making it a refreshing and affable pint.

description: The German version of a Pale Ale, this brew is straw yellow in color, light, crisp and refreshing.

available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.
available.name: Seasonal

description: Our Kolsch is a bright, light-bodied, moderately hopped golden ale/lager hybrid beer. We ferment and age it at lower temperatures than most of our ales to make it especially smooth, clean and refreshing. "Crisp" and "spritzy" are words that might come to mind when you try it.

description: Noted for its golden color and mellow, delicate flavor, Kolsch is a style of beer originating in the German city of Koln. H.C. Berger uses pure Colorado Mountain Water to brew this soft ale, which bears a slightly fruity palate and a dry, hoppy finish. Kolsch goes splendidly with grilled whitefish, salmon, or delicate Thai or Vietnamese-inspired foods.

description: A light-bodied, straw colored German ale as brewed in Cologne. Smooth with a nice, crisp finish.

description: A refreshingly cool german ale.  Brewed with a pale barley malt with a touch of wheat and the special german yeast to create a unique delightful flavor perfect for lazy summer days.

name: Kölsch

description: This clean light straw colored ale is much like a lager. It is fermented colder than most of our ales, though not as cold as a true lager. We also use German noble hop varieties to accentuate the lager-like qualities of this great summer beer.

description: Kölsch is a variant of the traditional German ales that originated in and around Cologne. Our award-winning version of this complex style introduces inexperienced beer drinkers to the art of craft-brewing while delivering upon the quality and flavor expectations of long-time beer enthusiasts.

name: Kölsch

description: A refreshing German style golden ale, perfect for summer drinking. Pale gold colour with a light honey-biscuit malt character, subtle passion fruit and pineapple flavours are delicately balanced with a light bitterness and drying finish. A Kölsch is delicious with salad, seafood or bruschetta.

foodPairings: A Kölsch is delicious with salad, seafood or bruschetta.
name: Kölsch

description: Our tribute to the traditional beer of Cologne, Lancaster Kölsch offers clean malt flavors from extended cold lagering and a firm noble hop character. The perfect session brew for any occasion, Lancaster Kölsch is a crisp and refreshing brew that pairs well with virtually any type of food.
